email_body:
OTC/

* We are currently unable to specify the information from the livelink log.

We are working on the problem, including the server room, and are working on the problem.

For that reason, we have confirmed that there is no problem with [Service for UNIX].

As a cause of the server crash, there are various possibilities other than the CA incompatibility,

For the separation of server crashes, please report the contents that became the cause of the crash!

* Also, as a problem with [Service for UNIX], it is not directly related to the use of Livelink,

Please be aware of that.

http://www.microsoft.com/japan/support/kb/articles/JP294/3/80.htm
http://www.microsoft.com/JAPAN/support/kb/articles/JP283/0/13.HTM?LN=JA&SD=SO&FR=0

We hope that the server crash will be resolved as soon as possible.

Sincerely,
Hitoshi Ito

-------- Original Message --------
Subject: RE: - ticket #55606OTC1 -
Date: Tue, 30 Oct 2001 13:44:43 -0500
From: "Hitoshi Ito" <>
Reply-To: <>
To: "'it-oh'" <>
CC: <>, <>,<>, <>

> Sincerely,
> Hitoshi Ito
>
> OpenText
>
> [Service for UNIX] Regarding the new case number, please let us know.
> We have received confirmation from the support engineer, but so far
> There is no example of using [Service for UNIX].
> There is a question about whether it works without problems.
> It is a system that is not supported, and there are also users who are actually using it,
> It is said that there is no such thing as 0.
> (Although it is reported in the support, it is! ...)
>
> Also, if [Service for UNIX] is a problem, it is considered to be
> If it is within the scope supported by the server crash,
> Please let us check it.
> If it is possible to resolve the cause that has been separated so far,
> I think.
> (The case is currently up to server crash case number 53121OTC1
> I have responded.)
>
> Thank you for your cooperation.
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: it-oh [mailto:]
> > Sent: Tuesday, October 30, 2001 5:16 AM
> > To:
> > Cc: ; ;
> > ;
> > Subject: Re: - ticket #53121OTC1 -
> >
> >
> > OTC/
> > * We are currently unable to specify the information from the livelink log.
> >
> > * We have confirmed the environment of the system that uses [Service for UNIX2.0]
> > on the FileSystem of Solaris2.6.
> > Also, the Oracle server, TableSpace, is on Solaris.
> >
> > In the past, [Service for UNIX] was a problem and became a server crash
> > Do you have any?
> > Also, if there are users who are using [Service for UNIX],
> > Please let us know without hesitation.
> >
> > Thank you for your cooperation.
> >
> > Sincerely,
> > Hitoshi Ito
